conclusion: Analyze the motion of the negatively charged particle in both the electric field between the metal plates and the magnetic field in the square region.
The particle is injected along the central line SO and moves in a straight line, indicating the electric force balances the magnetic force between the plates MN and PQ.
The electric force \(qE\) equals the magnetic force \(qvB\) since the particle moves in a straight line, leading to the equation \(E = vB\).
After exiting the electric field, the particle enters the magnetic field and moves in a circular path due to the magnetic force.
The magnetic force \(qvB\) provides the necessary centripetal force for circular motion, leading to the equation \(qvB =  rac{mv^2}{R}\).
Solving for the radius \(R\), we get \(R =  rac{mv}{qB}\).
The particle just fails to exit the magnetic field from side cd, meaning the maximum possible radius of the circular path is \(L\).
Substituting \(R = L\) into the equation gives \(L =  rac{mv}{qB}\).
The magnitude of the velocity of the particle when it is shot into point S is \(v =  rac{qBL}{m}\).
